intro: Strobilanthes walkeri var. walkeri, commonly known as the Malayan flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
